semantic_title: Bilateral Glaucoma Coding with Different Types or Stages
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 7. Chapter 7: Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa > a. Glaucoma > 3) Bilateral glaucoma stage with different types or stages

content.full_text: When a patient has bilateral glaucoma and each eye is documented as having a different type or stage, and the classification distinguishes laterality, assign the appropriate code for each eye rather than the code for bilateral glaucoma. When a patient has bilateral glaucoma and each eye is documented as having a different type, and the classification does not distinguish laterality (i.e., subcategories H40.10, and H40.20), assign one code for each type of glaucoma with the appropriate seventh character for the stage. When a patient has bilateral glaucoma and each eye is documented as having the same type, but different stage, and the classification does not distinguish laterality (i.e., subcategories H40.10 and H40.20), assign a code for the type of glaucoma for each eye with the seventh character for the specific glaucoma stage documented for each eye. (Evidence: pg no: 49, L21-L26)
